name: move forward
content:
Moves the sprite the specified number of pixels in the direction it is facing.

By default, the block moves sprites to the right (or east). However, changing the spriteâ€™s movement direction will change which direction it moves when moving forward.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: This airplane moves "forward". All sprites move to the right by default.

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: Extra code changes the sprite's starting direction. You can also change direction with the arrow keys.

palette_params.name: sprite
palette_params.description: The sprite or sprite group moving forward

palette_params.name: number
palette_params.description: The number of pixels the sprite is moving forward

short_description: Moves the sprite the specified number of pixels in the direction it is facing.
tips: - Using this block with [`turn`(#5ef3ff)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_turn/) or [`change sprite property`(#5ef3ff)](/docs/spritelab/gamelab_changePropBy/) (rotation) can allow a sprite to move in the direction that its costume is facing.
